name: Kale and Cabbage Soup
author: GinaG
summary: I made this recipe as a spin-off of Portuguese kale soup. I liked it so much! I like to serve this with freshly squeezed lemon juice or grated Parmesan cheese (but not both).
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Combine tomatoes, butter, dried minced onion, salt, and black pepper in a small saucepan over medium heat
Bring mixture to a simmer, place a cover on the saucepan, and cook at a simmer for 15 minutes
Heat olive oil in a stock pot over medium heat
Cook and stir celery, onion, garlic, and bay leaves in hot oil until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes
Add tomato mixture; cook and stir another 5 minutes
Pour water into the stock pot
Stir green cabbage, beef base, herbes de Provence, and red pepper flakes into the water
Loosely cover the stock pot and cook the mixture for 25 minutes
Stir kidney beans and kale into the soup
Again loosely cover the pot and continue cooking another 15 minutes
